revised_title: Neuroanatomy of Differentiated Neurons in Amphibian Embryo Spinal Cord
tldr: The authors used horseradish peroxidase to stain spinal cord neurons in Xenopus laevis embryos and identified nine differentiated neuron classes, including sensory Rohon-Beard cells, motoneurons, and various interneurons. This anatomical account provides a detailed description of the organization of neurons in the spinal cord, making the Xenopus embryo a promising model system for studying the nervous origins and bases for behavior.
